subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Microsoft Zune: The iPod Killer That Couldn't
description: A quick, practical guide to Microsoft Zune: The iPod Killer That Couldn't.

hook.text: Microsoft launched the Zune in 2006 to kill the iPod. It was brown. That told you everything.

buildup.text: The Zune actually had a great feature: wireless sharing. You could beam songs to nearby Zunes.

discovery.text: Shared songs self-destructed after three plays. Microsoft turned a cool feature into a frustration.

twist.text: Apple launched the iPhone a year later, making all dedicated music players obsolete overnight.

climax.text: Microsoft discontinued Zune in 2011. It sold 2 million units. The iPod had sold 400 million.

punchline.text: Copying a product is not the same as understanding it.
